intro: Brodiaea laxa, commonly known as the loose brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Brodiaea laxa is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in well-drained soil conditions.
